bio: Core team @ Ethereum Attestation Service. Product person and public goods builder with some salty dev & design skills. Loves a good street taco.
contributionDescription:
EAS has been natively integrated into the OP Stack codebase and linked by two predeploy addresses for registering schemas and making attestations onchain or offchain. All future OP Stack chains automatically inherit the contracts at Genesis. 

These contracts unlock new opportunities for builders passionate about identity, reputation, governance, voting, social & beyond.

Did you know?
- EAS powers the AttestationStation V1
- RetroPGF profiles & badgeholders are attested to using EAS
- Gitcoin Passport uses EAS to attest to stamps & scores on OP
- Base uses the predeploy contracts
+ more use cases

We've also contributed:
- An OP Attestation Explorer
- An SDK + API to get devs building faster
- No-code tools for making schemas & attestations
- Educational content & docs for attestations

contributionLinks.description: EAS natively integrated into the OP Github repo
OP Mainnet predeploy contract for making attestations using EAS
OP Mainnet predeploy contract for registering schemas using EAS

impactDescription:
EAS has been natively integrated into the core OP Stack infrastructure as two predeploy addresses and positioned OP as the ecosystem leader for attestations. 

The contracts have enabled:
- RetroPGF profiles to be attested to
- OP Badgeholders to be attested to
- Gitcoin Passports to push their offchain stamps & scores onchain to Optimism.
- Guild to query OP attestations using the EAS GraphQL API and ultimately enable teams to gate chats & communities with attestations that have been made.
- Base to provide attestations to their builders by using the predeploy contracts
+ more

Attestations are enabling builders to explore new use cases around identity, reputation systems, governance, registries, voting, social networks, and more throughout the Superchain.

fundingSources.description: OP Grant awarded for improvements to the Attestation Explorer experience

pwRecategorizeReason: NO. The application is from an individual acting as the core team member of Ethereum Attestation Service, hence it should be categorized as "INDIVIDUAL".
pwCategorySuggestions: Decentralized Identity, Governance & Tokens, Tokenization Platforms
